programme.title: Soviet Storm
programme.desc: Kiev, the Ukrainian capital, is, after a lengthy battle, back in Soviet hands. But now they have to clear the Germans and German allies out of the Crimea and liberate the rest of Western Ukraine. Hitler declared the Crimea a 'Festung,' meaning it should be held at all cost and to the last man. The German 17th Army was effectively destroyed in the process.

programme.title: Soviet Storm
programme.desc: On 22 June 1941, German pilots were the first to see the sun rise. Before the day was over, the Soviet Air Forces had lost almost 2 000 aircraft. The early German air superiority gave a significant boost to German confidence, and severely damaged Soviet military capability and morale.

programme.title: Soviet Storm
programme.desc: Hours before the start of Operation Barbarossa, the Germans, along with their Finnish allies, begin mining the Gulf of Finland to prevent any naval evacuation of Soviet troops and ships. When Operation Barbarossa begins, Axis U-boats begin pounding the grand Soviet Navy, primarily based at Leningrad.

programme.title: Soviet Storm
programme.desc: By 1943-1944, as the Germans are desperately struggling to hold their ground, they are increasingly hindered by the Soviet partisans, which contain many former Red Army soldiers that had been cut off behind enemy lines. The Germans responded with intensive counter-insurgency campaigns and brutal reprisals against the civilian population.

programme.title: Soviet Storm
programme.desc: Shortly before the outbreak of the Second World War, the Polish and British have succeeded in de-coding the top secret German military codes known as 'Enigma.' This information, referred to as 'Ultra' by the Allies, becomes vital for the Allies' military situation in North Africa, the Soviet Union, and Northern France.

programme.title: Soviet Storm
programme.desc: Germany is retreating on all fronts and suffering defeat after defeat. The breach of Germany's pre-War borders now seems inevitable. Desperate, Hitler orders all males between the ages of 16 and 70 to enlist and fight for the fatherland. Nazi ideologues put faith in victory and the Nazis seem to vanquish and suppress all forms of doubt and resistance in the last months of the Reich.

programme.title: World of Warships Clash of Titans
programme.desc: In May 1941, the British Royal Navy pursues the battleship Bismarck with the mission to sink.

programme.title: World of Warships Clash of Titans
programme.desc: The rise of submarines marks World War II at sea, leading to fierce battles.

programme.title: World of Warships Clash of Titans
programme.desc: On July 3, 1940, the British fleet attacks the French navy at Mers el-KÃ©bir, Algeria.

programme.title: World of Warships Clash of Titans
programme.sub-title: The Fabulous Destiny of the Battleship Texas
programme.desc: The USS Texas helps silence batteries of German artillery and gun positions defending Cherbourg.

programme.title: World of Warships Clash of Titans
programme.desc: Allied convoys resupplying the Soviet Union navigate the Arctic, infested with enemy aircraft.

programme.title: World of Warships Clash of Titans
programme.desc: In May 1905, Russia's Pacific squadron arrives at the Tsushima Strait.

programme.title: World of Warships Clash of Titans
programme.desc: In 1941, Japan attacks Pearl Harbor, aiming to destroy the U.S. fleet and control the Pacific.

programme.title: World War II: Battles Won & Lost
programme.desc: Some words transcend their origins as humble place names. Even as the names given to battles won and lost: Battle Of The Atlantic, Pearl Harbor, The Russian Offensive, El Alamein, Deippe Raid, Battle of Okinawa.

programme.title: World War II: Battles Won & Lost
programme.sub-title: Blitzkrieg, Commando Raids, Landings, Desert War
programme.desc: The battles of the WWI were battles of attrition, opposing armies hardly moving between lines of trenches. The battles of WWII were much more dynamic: The Battle Of France, Kursk, Iwo Jima, the Siege of Tobruk and Operation Crusader.

programme.title: World War II: Battles Won & Lost
programme.desc: Battles are almost always about territory, with the objectives of advancing the front line, seizing the port, the city, the oil field, and more: The Battle of Stalingrad, The Battle Of Britain, Singapore,The Anzio Landings, The Gustav line and Monte Cassino, Battle of The Philippine Sea.

programme.title: World War II: Battles Won & Lost
programme.sub-title: Air Battles At Sea, Great Battles on Land
programme.desc: The first battle at sea, in which enemy ships never sighted each other and the largest army ever to march when Germany launched its invasion of the Soviet Union. As well as the largest seaborne invasion in history: Operation Barbarossa, The D-Day Landings, The Battle of The Coral Sea, Arakon, Rommel; The Desert Fox, The Invasion of Sicily and Italy.

programme.title: World War II: Battles Won & Lost
programme.sub-title: Jungle & City fighting, Sea Battles, Invasions, Advances & Retreats
programme.desc: A war that reached every continent and touched every sort of terrain demanded a wide variety of strategies and tactics: Dunkirk, Malaya, The River Plate, Operation Market Garden, Syria and The Battle Of Berlin.

programme.title: World War II: Battles Won & Lost
programme.desc: A world war is a patchwork of actions: Land, sea, air, massive or small scale. And these stories of these actions are just as varied: Battle of The Bulge, Battle of Midway, Case Blue, Operation Longcloth, Bagration, Battle of The Scheldt.

programme.title: World War II: Battles Won & Lost
programme.desc: Through history, armies marched to face each other on favored ground and clashed to decide a campaign, a war, an empire. During WWII that changed: Kokoda Australian Campaign, Soviet Finnish war, Kasserine Pass, Burma, Convoy PQ17, Battle of Moscow.

programme.title: Jungle War
programme.desc: The series begins in the Second World War, in jungles of the Pacific. As Japan shocks the world with the speed of its advance, the Allies scramble to halt what seems to be an unstoppable force. Amidst it all, the men on the ground struggle with another far more formidable opponent - the jungle itself. They endure energy sapping heat, diseases and starvation.

programme.title: Jungle War
programme.desc: By the end of 1942 the tide of the war in the Pacific is turning. Guadalcanal and the island hopping campaigns shift the balance as the Allies advance toward victory over Japan. We explore the aftershocks of the Second World War as new leaders applied jungle warfare tactics to new struggles for independence in the Malayan Emergency and the First Indochina War.

programme.title: Jungle War
programme.desc: Episode Three begins with Konfrontasi - a conflict between Indonesia and Malaysia which centres on fighting in the jungles of Borneo. We then turn to what was arguably the most televised jungle war in history, the Second Indochina War, known in Vietnam as the American War. A war in which the US sought to stand as the 'guardians at the gate' against the spread of communism in South East Asia.

programme.title: Jungle War
programme.desc: In this episode we explore the final years of the war in Vietnam, which saw the United States and her Allies confront the realities of loss and withdrawal from a jungle war. The series concludes with the revolutions that began in the jungles of Cuba and Colombia and changed the course of both nations' history.

programme.title: Spies and Intelligence: From the OSS to the CIA
programme.desc: This film shows an orientation tour of Fort Bradley, including perimeter fences, access control, guard force, and safety equipment.

programme.title: Spies and Intelligence: From the OSS to the CIA
programme.desc: This filmed teleplay, produced by Warner Brothers, tells the story of an American diplomat in Poland who was ensnared by Polish intelligence into providing classified information to the Communists.
